sections.title: opening
sections.subtext: A Story of Truth and Power

sections.title: the-world
sections.headline: India. But Not As You Know It.
sections.content: In 1717, a single decision changed everything. The East India Company was denied its charter. Without colonial extraction, the subcontinent developed on its own terms—building, learning, and eventually unifying under a different kind of power.

sections.title: the-regime
sections.headline: Four Decades of Order
sections.content: The Military Council rules with precision. After the chaos of civil war, they offered stability—and the nation accepted. Now the Mesh watches everything: every transaction, every movement, every word spoken in the open. Peace has a price. Most have stopped counting.

sections.title: the-peace
sections.headline: Stability Feels Like Home
sections.content: Trains run on time. Markets function. Children attend school without fear. The older generation remembers the decade of blood—the bombings, the curfews, the friends who vanished. They teach their children to appreciate what the Council provides. Most believe them.
sections.visual: Orderly urban scenes, everyday life under surveillance

sections.title: the-crack
sections.content: Twenty locations. Ten minutes. A synchronized attack that shattered decades of calm. The bombings killed fewer than the old wars, but something else died that day: the certainty that the Mesh sees everything. Someone moved unseen. Someone struck at the heart of order.

sections.title: the-hero
sections.headline: Kahaan
sections.content: A military prince. Born to privilege, trained for duty, assigned to find the truth. The Council gives him the case—the bombings, the conspiracy, the threat to everything he's sworn to protect. What he doesn't know: the investigation will lead him across nations, through generations, and into the darkest corners of his own history.

sections.title: the-question
sections.headline: What Would You Sacrifice for the Truth?
sections.content: Every lead uncovers a deeper secret. Every answer spawns new questions. Kahaan must choose: protect the order that raised him, or expose the lies at its foundation. In Bharatvarsh, some truths are more dangerous than any bomb.
